title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 35.10 - Acceptable proof of insurance
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 35.10 - Acceptable proof of insurance

State Regulations
A New York State insurance ID card issued by an insurance
company, agent or broker licensed by the NYS Department of Financial Services
in accordance with Part 32 of this Title. The insurance company shall be one
assigned an insurance company code (ICC) in accordance with Part 34 of this

Title. A New York Automobile Insurance Plan (NYAIP) Temporary New York State

Insurance Identification Card shall be accepted for registration only. A NYAIP
Temporary New York State Insurance Identification Card shall not be accepted as
proof of insurance for any nonregistration activity including but not limited
to responding to a registrant inquiry letter and suspension or revocation
order. DMV shall not accept a second insurance ID card from a registrant for
the same insurance company with the same effective date if the validity of the
earlier insurance ID card from that insurance company is at issue or if the
insurance ID card has been repudiated by that insurance
company. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
35.10

Amended

New

York State Register April 26, 2017 /Volume XXXIX, Issue 17, eff. 4/26/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
